trans-unit.source: Managing credentials in the elastic database client library
trans-unit.target: Managing credentials in the elastic database client library

trans-unit.source: How to set the right level of credentials, admin to read-only, for elastic database apps.
trans-unit.target: How to set the right level of credentials, admin to read-only, for elastic database apps.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>Elastic Database client library</linkText><title></title> uses credentials for different types of operations–in particular creating or manipulating a <linkText>Shard map manager</linkText><title></title>, referencing an existing Shard Map Manager to obtain information about shards, and connecting to shards.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>Elastic Database client library</linkText><title></title> uses credentials for different types of operations–in particular creating or manipulating a <linkText>Shard map manager</linkText><title></title>, referencing an existing Shard Map Manager to obtain information about shards, and connecting to shards.

trans-unit.source: Credentials for these types of operations are discussed below.
trans-unit.target: Credentials for these types of operations are discussed below.

trans-unit.source: Management credentials for shard map access: The management credentials are used when instantiating a ShardMapManager object for applications that manipulate the shard maps.
trans-unit.target: Management credentials for shard map access: The management credentials are used when instantiating a ShardMapManager object for applications that manipulate the shard maps.

trans-unit.source: The user of the elastic scale client library must create the necessary SQL users and SQL logins and make sure they are granted the read/write permissions on the global shard map database and all shard databases as well.
trans-unit.target: The user of the elastic scale client library must create the necessary SQL users and SQL logins and make sure they are granted the read/write permissions on the global shard map database and all shard databases as well.

trans-unit.source: These credentials are used to maintain the global shard map and the local shard maps when changes to the shard map are performed.
trans-unit.target: These credentials are used to maintain the global shard map and the local shard maps when changes to the shard map are performed.

trans-unit.source: This is because credentials must work against both the Shard Map Manager database and individual shards, which may be on different servers.

trans-unit.source: User credentials for shard map manager access: When instantiating the shard map manager in an application that is not going to administer shard maps, use credentials that have read-only permissions on the global shard map.
trans-unit.target: User credentials for shard map manager access: When instantiating the shard map manager in an application that is not going to administer shard maps, use credentials that have read-only permissions on the global shard map.

trans-unit.target: The information retrieved from the global shard map under these credentials are used for <linkText>data-dependent routing</linkText><title></title> and to populate the shard map cache on the client.

trans-unit.source: User credentials for user data access: Additional credentials are needed when using the OpenConnectionForKey method to access a shard associated with a key.
trans-unit.target: User credentials for user data access: Additional credentials are needed when using the OpenConnectionForKey method to access a shard associated with a key.

trans-unit.source: These credentials need to provide permissions for read-only access to the local shard map tables residing on the shard.
trans-unit.target: These credentials need to provide permissions for read-only access to the local shard map tables residing on the shard.

trans-unit.source: This is needed to perform connection validation for data-dependent routing on the shard.
trans-unit.target: This is needed to perform connection validation for data-dependent routing on the shard.
